Fields.DialogueText: Are you excited about our new mission?
Why would I be?
Well, we're transporting an experimental weapon.
And?
That's always exciting, isn't it?
It would be more interesting if I were the one to test it.

Fields.MenuText: You feeling bloodthirsty today?
Is this a "following orders" thing?
Your curiosity is admirable.

Fields.DialogueText: Perceptive as ever, Capitaine.
When am I not, Capitaine? --But that is not the problem.
Hah. It's not a desire for *intellectual* stimulation.
This is just another order that I have to follow, without regard for my own desires. I obey out of love for you, and out of necessity.
But why on *earth* would I be happy about it?
Good question. I guess...
I can't let you use it, because it's untested, and aerial mines are--
You do not have to tell me how dangerous mines are.
*ALARM*
The witches want a refit too, it seems.
They won't get it from our guns. Stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
... I'm not above getting you new torpedoes to brighten your mood.
Bribery doesn't address the issues, Capitaine. But I wouldn't say no.
So. Capitaine. It's time to talk about your tattoo.
My... what, now?
If you serve on my ship for any length of time, I give you a tattoo. It's... a way to bond.
You have a funny idea of bonding.
I'm about to be *hilarious.*
Wait, wait, you're not about to tattoo me without asking?
What? Of course not.
Phew.
I've still got to draw up the design.
Well...
If I were to give you a tattoo, what would you want the design to be?

Fields.MenuText: A snake like yours. But--
My nation's flag, but--
Hang on, hang on! I never said I *wanted* a tattoo!

Fields.DialogueText: You did not. But this is important to me.
"But?" Where is the "but" here, Capitaine?
I am flattered. Why the hesitation, though?
I don't want to set a bad example to the crew, LT.
You think having a *tattoo* around *sailors* is a crime?
No, that's not--
*ALARM*
Ugh. We'll talk about this later.
I will hold you to that.
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Can we speak for a moment?
Always. What's wrong, Sato?
Well... it's about the weapon.
The UP? Everyone has an opinion on that thing.
I-- I-- I think-- we should throw it overboard.
Why? It's not as if it's dangerous.
Or, well, not more dangerous than our current guns.
... I think shooting mines *up* into the sky is more dangerous, Kanchou.
That's what I told Command, but then... one of the engineers pointed something out. Something I hadn't thought of.
Wh-what is it?
Well, Belles can control their armaments, right?
Right...
A Belle armed with an UP can control the mines she lays. In the air.
Think about the military applications.
I suppose that's true. But without a Belle, they'll just fall back down. Right?
Lucky for us, we have Le Terrible.
We-- we do. D-does she scare you too?

Fields.MenuText: She's intense, but we can handle her.
Even if she does, she's our Belle.
Absolutely. But it's part of her charm.

Fields.DialogueText: I g-guess you're right...
She is. And I want to trust her...
You're very c-confident...
She s-scares me. But I look up to her a lot...
Did she give you a tattoo too?
Mmhm... Look.
Snake scales?
Like hers. It's... funny, isn't it....?
What is?
She makes me panic... but.... when I think about being more like her... I'm c-calmer.
*ALARM*
Well, try to be like her now. C'mon!
@BATTLE
Be on your guard, Capitaine.
What's wrong?
Nothing concrete. But I have an intuition...
Heeheeheeheeheeheehee!
Zut! That little brat.
Something's coming.
Sound the goddamn alarm, people!
@BATTLE
We've lost contact with her, Kanchou!
Mischief? She's right there.
Her hull is right there, Capitaine. But look at the deck.
Oh! There's no one there.
Exactement. We've lost contact with *Mischief.*

Fields.MenuText: She can't have gone far!
Maybe we killed her already?
Run the ASDIC. We've got to find her.

Fields.DialogueText: The ASDIC is designed to find a hundred tons of metal. Not a little girl.
She's not dead until we have a body. Preferably one torn in half.
That is *not* the problem, Capitaine.
Hee hee hee... you just keep talking... and talking... and talking...
How the hell did you get onto the deck?!
Stay back! We don't know what she's planning.
Mmmm, isn't it obvious?
I want to plaaaaaay. Hee hee.
And you have suuuuch a fun new toy.
She's going for the rocket projector!
Golly, this is *way* more fun than putting a bucket over the door.
She's set off the mines - but they're not falling?!
Wheeeeeeeeee... I can spin them.... roll them... doodle with them...
Mischief, put them down, *now*.
Aw, sis, you're no fun.
Sis?!
You don't have to do this, Mischief. We both know that you could do something grander than this.
You keep saying that... hmm....
Oh no.
Thanks for the idea, sis! I'll just take this....
Kanchou, did her *doll* just - lift the rocket projector? That thing weighs tons--
Bye bye, sis. I'll have fun with this toy...
The mines are dropping! What do we do--

Fields.MenuText: Get out of the goddamn way!
Shoot them down!
Pick a god and pray--

Fields.DialogueText: There's no time--
We can't turn in time--
U-understood--
Nnnnnnghhhhh!
I'm - taking control - of the mines, Capitaine--
Get the ship - out of the way.
Understood. Let's get Mischief - before she gets away.
Gggghnnn. Little bitch - stronger than she looks.
Hurry, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
She's getting away! After her!
Throwing... the mines... Capitaine!
@BATTLE
Merde. After all that... she got away.
She did. And *we* have to talk.
What about, Capitaine?
She called you her sister.
Oui. It is not a term I would have chosen for myself.
So why did *she* choose it?
You do not think I am a *traitor,* do you?

Fields.MenuText: You call yourself a monster. How do I know you're not in league with them?
"Traitor" is a strong word. But I think you're hiding something.
I trust you, LT. But for all our sakes, I need to know what's going on.

Fields.DialogueText: *I* am not hiding anything, Capitaine. We haven't encountered Mischief before. Not this way. That's all.
I *am* a monster. But just because I am a monster does not mean that I love all monsters more than humans.
Well, thank you. But it's not that complicated...
So what's the story with you and Mischief?
... I like her attitude, Capitaine. She doesn't want gods or masters either. She wants to have "fun," and she's nasty and inventive.
Convince her that she'd have more "fun" attacking her sisters, and we'd have a powerful ally.
And you've been trying to do that?
Oui. Since I laid eyes on her. And she calls me "big sister" because... well...
You're the big sister who tells her she's not allowed to do anything fun?
Precisely. I know it's foolish, but I have a certain amount of affection for the little brat. She reminds me of myself.
Well, this time it backfired.
Oui. I take full responsibility for that.
I know trying to keep you from doing something is an exercise in futility.
It is.
So I won't tell you to stop trying to "convince" her. But we need to get the UP back.
Of course. You will have it back as soon as possible, Capitaine.
You look exhausted, Le Terrible.
*Va te faire enculer.*
Yeah, I can see that. What's got your knickers in a twist?
I have not slept for three nights in a row, Capitaine. Of course I am "exhausted."
What?! Why haven't you slept?
I was keeping watch for Mischief.
Ugh. When you said you'd take "full responsibility," I didn't expect *this.*
Well, what *do* you want me to do?! If she's out there with the UP--
Who knows what she could do with it. I get it. But.
But what?! She needs to be stopped.
And working yourself to death won't stop her.
If we can't stop her, I'll never forgive myself.

Fields.MenuText: I don't need you to forgive yourself, but I do need you to take care of yourself.
We will stop her. Together. So you need to rest.
If you don't take care of yourself, we'll never stop her.

Fields.DialogueText: Touché. But nevertheless...
You are ever the optimist. But I see your point.
That's good. If you needed me to forgive myself, you'd be waiting until the sun went out.
As your Captain, I can't give you an order you'll listen to. But as your lover, I'm begging you. Find somewhere else to put your energy.
... Like the tattoo design?
If you *must.*
*ALARM*
Fighting Morganas is also an option, it seems.
My syringes are ready, Capitaine. Let's get them!
@BATTLE
I thought doing *that* was *your* job.
Ughhhhh. I'm not in the mood.
You're drawing like crazy! Is this that tattoo design you keep talking about?
Oui.
Snakes... scorpions... fangs... eyes... good grief.
Do not unroll the crumpled sketches, Capitaine. They're not very good.
You sound like Provence.
I've contacted her for help with this. She is a better artist than I am.
You discussed this with her and not with me?
Is that a problem?
You discussed the tattoo... the tattoo that you want to put on my body forever... with Provence... and without me.
Ah, is that what this is about?
If it makes you feel better, think of it as a thought experiment. I will not put a needle on your body without your express permission.
That's not the *problem!*
Then what is, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: I want more input on the design.
I don't even want a tattoo.
I'm an artist too. Maybe I could help.

Fields.DialogueText: You will have it. *After* I consult with Provence.
You can make that decision when I have a final design. Perhaps you will like it more than you think.
Then the three of us can discuss it together.
*ALARM*
This isn't over, Le Terrible.
Of course not. But now is not the time to squabble. To arms!
@BATTLE
Still no sign of her.
Mischief?
Oui. It is as if she has disappeared off the face of the earth.
Well, maybe that's a good thing.
It would be. If she didn't have the UP.
... Don't remind me.
Oh-- there's a Morgana!
You think it's your "little sister"?
No, Captain. Smell that? Pus and blood.
Ah. Your nemesis.
*ALARM*
Sound the alarm, people! And pull back, NOW. We'll get her from a distance.
@BATTLE
You took my recommendation. Huh.
Your... recommendation?
If we see Disease, we destroy her on sight. No dithering, and no mercy.
You took my recommendation. You didn't make orders for the sake of saving face.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you were right last time.
I didn't want a repeat performance.

Fields.DialogueText: None of us do. And yet... you still could have denied me out of pride.
And yet other capitaines would not change their minds if they thought it would encourage mutiny.
You might be a wild-eyed bomb thrower. But I don't think you'll throw them at me.
Why not?
You're designing me a tattoo, aren't you?
Touché, Capitaine. You have nothing to fear from me.
... For now.
For now.
Mail call again. You've got one from Provence.
Oh? Thank you, Capitaine.
Ah, it *is* a response to my last letter. I wondered.
You write each other often?
She sends handmade postcards. I think she just wants an excuse to show off her art.
But anyway... she wants to meet up in Le Havre. She's hoping to make some architectural sketches.
You want to visit her?
Well, it's where we were going to deliver the UP. We might as well.
... Assuming that's where that little *salope* is going.

Fields.MenuText: It's the nearest city. I think we can safely assume that.
The crew needs a break anyway.
Even if we didn't need to rest, we need to take on more supplies.

Fields.DialogueText: Do those "supplies" include more guns for me?
I'll think about it.
It's true we took a morale hit. After... you know.
With Morganas, you cannot safely assume anything.
*ALARM*
Maybe that's Mischief.
Ever the optimist, aren't you?
@BATTLE
Ah, Sato. Tell me...
Eep!
Is there anyone aboard you like?
I-I-I--
Like, say, our Capitaine?
Le Terrible? What are you doing?
Let go of poor Sato. Now.
Arigato, Kanchou. I'm-- I'm just going to--
You're dismissed.
Capitaine, why are you giving me that look?
You know full well why. Don't terrorize my crew.
I am not *terrorizing* anyone! I am trying to protect my heart, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, you *do* have one. Sometimes I forget.
I nearly forgot you were French.
Doesn't matter what you were trying to do. Don't terrorize my crew.

Fields.DialogueText: And what is *that* supposed to mean?
Zut, Capitaine, you really do take their safety seriously.
All monsters do.
I was just trying to find my rival!
Your... what?
You've grown cold the last few days, Capitaine. That means I must have a rival. And I'm going to find them.
Oh, for the love of--
*ALARM*
Take that anger, and put it into fighting Morganas. All right?
... Fine. We can talk about this later.
@BATTLE
I haven't "grown cold" because I'm seeing someone else, I've grown cold because you're trying to badger me into getting a *tattoo*.
But-- Capitaine--
Le Terrible from St. Agricola, are you recieving?
Reading you loud and clear, St. Agricola. Why'd you hail us?
One of the local fishing boats just hailed us, Capitaine. They seem agitated.
Patch them through.
There's something strange going on out there. We wanted to warn you.
*What's* going on?
When we sailed out of Le Havre, we went a little further than usual.... those Fata Morgana appeared, and of course we ran, but...
Get to the point, monsieur.
When we started to run, one of them threw something. It looked like a nautical mine, but it hung in the sky for a moment--
*Bordel de merde.*
And then it came crashing down. We barely escaped with our lives!
Thank you. We'll take care of it, Captain. Le Terrible out.
That's her, Capitaine! We need to go after her.

Fields.MenuText: We also need to repair and resupply.
If she's in the area, she'll come to us.
We do. But we'll make our pit stop first.

Fields.DialogueText: There's nothing more certain in this world, is there?
We do. But if we can get her first--
Rendezvous with Provence first? I suppose that makes sense.
*ALARM*
Rest isn't a luxury. I don't trust our odds if we try to fight her first.
Friendship will always pull us through.
Well, there's one thing.
@BATTLE
Capitaine? A word?
What's on your mind?
I'm going into the town. I thought you should know.
What about Mischief? We need you here.
Provence said she would be in port to sketch. We phoned her and she wasn't aboard.
So you're going to go look for her?
She's something of a free spirit. It's admirable. But...
If I do not find her, we will not have her at our side.
And considering that we are dealing with Belle magic... having two Belles to deal with floating mines is better than one, no?

Fields.MenuText: If you don't come back, we'll have no Belles.
Can't you send a sailor to deal with this?
I trust you. Just come back in one piece.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Capitaine. I will be as careful as I always am.
Well, that's ... "reassuring."
We need speed and discretion.
You're half there.
I fully intend to, Capitaine.
You know where good intentions lead.
We got company, incoming!
They got Mischief?
Negative.
Bordel de merde.
@BATTLE
Capitaine. I'm going to do this whether you like it or not.
But I thought I would do you the good grace of *telling* you.
Do not make me regret this decision.
... Fine. But if you're not back in an hour, I'm sending someone to find you.
I can't go *that* far from the ship. Let's hope that won't be necessary.
We can only hope. ... Good luck, LT.
Capitaine! Do you see-- over there--
Those black things in the sky?
They look like naval mines. But they're floating.
Son of a *bitch.* LE TERRIBLE--
She hasn't come back, Capitaine.
Goddammit.

Fields.MenuText: Get off this boat. Go into town and find her.
Sit tight. I'm going to go find her.

Fields.DialogueText: Into the town? K-Kanchou, it's massive--
A-and leave the ship? Are you putting me in command?
*BOOM*
Someone just set off the bomb!
We're going to have to shoot as many of them down as we can.
Rally the troops and get the gas masks. We'll hold them off as long as we can.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We need a communications officer who can bang a drum she can hear for kilometers.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou--
I'm only half-joking. We can't afford--
Can I just say, this was a terrible idea?
Your pun's been *noted* and *discarded.* How do we get back to the harbour?
It should be this way--
*BOOM*
*Run.*
You don't have to tell me twice--
What are those explosions? They don't sound like conventional weapons--
I'll explain later. Come on--
Mon *dieu.* Look at the sky-- The mines-- the Morganas' masts--
Oh, I am going to have to *paint* this!
You can paint it if we survive. Come on - There's the harbour!
Hee hee hee! You were right, sis... I *could* be so much more than I am.
You give the UP *back.* *Now.*
Mlehhhhhh. Make me.
Oh, I *fully* intend to *make* you!
@BATTLE
Isn't this a fun new toy? So many different things you can do with it...
And I have you to thank, big sis. Without you, I never would have thought of putting mines in the sky.
Put that thing down, now.
Oh? You want me to put it down?
*SPLASH*
*KABOOM*
There's humans down there! They didn't ask for any of this.
So? It's funny.
Funnier if they can fight back, non?
You want a reaction. A reaction is funnier when it's big.
Mmmm... You have a point. On the other hand... you're here.
And you can fight back, can't you...?
Merde. Le Terrible-- look out--
I'll tell you what. Here's thirteen more mines.
I'll drop one... eeeevery... hour.
You have guns and bombs. And two Belles. Getting them down should be easy, shouldn't it...?
This isn't what I meant--
Of course it isn't. That's why it's funny!
Capitaine, what do we do?

Fields.MenuText: LT - Stop trying to negotiate, you're making it worse!
We can't go along with this. We have to stop her.
What we always do. We'll stop her.

Fields.DialogueText: A nice sentiment. Now how do we follow through?
I am *not* negotiating. I am stalling for time. The more time she spends talking to me, the less she has to play with her new "toy."
*Obviously!* Now how do we do that?!
Well, she's still playing. We need to *stop* her, not *stall* her.
How do you propose we do that?
Well, like Mischief said... we have two Belles. And she has a short attention span.
I think I see what you are playing at, Capitaine.
One of us sails out to confront Mischief. The other stays here in the harbor. When she drops a mine, the Belle in the harbor catches it and redirects it. Somewhere safe.
I volunteer! I will stay behind.
You don't want a chance to give that little bitch a taste of her own medicine?
I do! But I *also* want the chance to hand-place explosions. Just *imagine* the painting--
All right, all right! Yes, that was my plan. Guess it's a bit obvious.
It is, but let's put it into action.
@BATTLE
Stay sharp! She brought friends!
There goes the first mine!
I trust Provence. Look - it's still in the air.
Oh god, what's she doing with it? It's *spinning.*
She's probably deciding where to put it. Typical.
Come, Capitaine. We've got to get to Mischief.
You don't sound too thrilled.
I made a mistake. Of course I'm not thrilled.
What mistake?
I put too much trust in Mischief's better nature.
... I thought I could harness her sense of humor. But she's not coming around to our side any time soon. That means she's the enemy.

Fields.MenuText: It's not that black and white.
You're right. We need to get rid of her as soon as possible.
It doesn't matter whether she does or not. This is an emergency.

Fields.DialogueText: We'd all love to think so, Capitaine.
Of course, Capitaine. And we'll deal with it.
What do you think I am doing?
She's coming into view. Give her everything we've got - and be ready to catch the mines when she sinks.
I was born ready, Capitaine. --Vive l'humanité!
@BATTLE
Little coward. She's running away!
Then follow her!
We're in hot pursuit, Capitaine.
Good. We'll catch up with her in no time.
Mon dieu, I hope so.
... Why are you making that face?
What face? I'm not making a face.
Suit yourself.
... That's the second mine.
Provence can handle it.
I know she can handle it! Quit giving me that dirty look!
I'm not giving you a look!
Suit your-goddamn-self.
Don't you trust me?
Do you trust me?

Fields.MenuText: Unconditionally.
I only trust you if I don't have to say no to you.
Not as far as I can throw you.

Fields.DialogueText: ... That's not trust, Capitaine.
Remember the tattoos?
... Well, that's more than I expected. Thank you.
... I should have been more pessimistic.
How could I forget?
It can be hard to, sometimes.
... You don't respect what I say I need. That makes it hard.
When you say you need something, you make it an order.
If it's about my own goddamn body--
Kanchou! We've got her!
We can continue this conversation later. Open fire!
@BATTLE
Okay, here goes nothing. We've got to board her.
Can't we just... sink her?
We have to get the mine projector back.
It's a whole shed. We'll have to have half the crew board her.

Fields.MenuText: Which means we've got to neutralize her first.
Which means we're left undefended.
I guess we *could* go with plan B and dredge it up...

Fields.DialogueText: You said that would damage it beyond repair. We should try to keep it intact.
Precisely, Capitaine. And I think I know how to do that.
I trust Provence. If we need backup, she's there.
All right. The plan: get aboard, neutralize her, get the UP, and get off. Then sink her.
It's two against one. We can do this!
We can, and I know exactly how I'm going to do it.
Should I be scared, or intrigued?
A soupçon of both?
Let's see what you've got in mind.
It's simple, Capitaine...
*BOOM*
No more time for plans! She's opened fire!
Then what are we waiting for? Fire back!
@BATTLE
Oh, you got aboard! I didn't think you'd make it this far.
You want a lolly for your trouble? They're not poisoned. Much.
*Casse couilles et ferme ta gueule.*
Oh my gosh. You've got a pottymouth, big sis.
Quit playing innocent, you little--! You know what you're doing is wrong!
Do I? Do you?
Didn't I just say--
How do you know I would have dropped any mines at all if you hadn't shown up?
Because you *did!* More than *once!*
Did I? Clumsy me. Hee hee.
This isn't funny! Stop *laughing!*
Oh, it's the funniest. The look on *your* face--
Shut. The hell. Up.
What's the matter? Can't you take a joke?
The lives of other people are not a joke!
Keep her talking! We need her distracted.
... what?
Looks like you're the butt of the joke.
We've secured the UP!
No! No no no no-- This wasn't supposed to happen--
Kanchou, it's firing off like crazy--

Fields.MenuText: Provence! Where are you?
Le Terrible, do something!
GET DOWN!

Fields.DialogueText: That will not be necessary, Capitaine.
Already on it, Capitaine.
I've already taken care of that.
Evacuate... the ship. With the UP... if you can.
You heard her! --You can hold the mines up?
She's holding up the mines!
Glad.... you... noticed.
For... a minute. Yes.
You heard her! MOVE!
@BATTLE
Provence-- Catch!
Oh-- *Dannazione,* these are heavy!
Hold them. Or explode them aesthetically. I do not care.
My time to shine!
*BOOM*
Ha... ha... that was fun... right? Our little joke?
Big sis-- Eep!
Capitaine - throw me the rope.

Fields.MenuText: What are you going to do to her?
*Please* don't commit a war crime.
Here's the rope. What're you going to do with it--

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing you wouldn't in my place.
Morganas are not human. You *cannot* commit war crimes against them.
But aren't you--
Hush.
Provence - give me one of those mines?
But my design--
I need one *now.*
Catch, then!
@BATTLE
(No matter how long I live, I'll never get used to Belles throwing around munitions like children's toys.)
Now... Let's talk about what we're going to do to *you.*
*Gulp!*
Then don't! Kill them as many times as you have to!
LT, we can't hold them off forever!
Now let's talk about what I'm going to do to you. I've tied you to the mast...
I-it was just a joke! I swear, it was just a joke!
Well, I'm going to play a "joke" on you.
Everyone off the ship? I'm dropping the mine in three... two....
Nnn-- Gotta-- I gotta--
Bleh! I caught it, stupid!
Mmhm. But how long can you hold it, now that you've worn yourself out? For that matter... how far can you throw it?
... ohcrap.
I'm sorry, sis. I'm sorry. I didn't mean--
You didn't mean to put the lives of thousands of people in danger? You didn't *mean* to steal a dangerous, experimental weapon?
It was... it was just a joke.
Well, *golly...* this must be a "joke" too.
Wait-- wait, please--
Captain! I'm debarking now!
Welcome back, Le Terrible.
That was incredible! You were *terrifying.*
It *is* in the name.
I will have to paint you one of these days. Perhaps if I hit a Yellow Period.
Merci, mon amie. I knew you'd do well.
Oh, you're the hero of the day.

Fields.MenuText: You really are.
That was some quick thinking and some quick action.
I can't condone what you did to Mischief, but...

Fields.DialogueText: It was completely warranted, Capitaine.
Let me finish.
It is my job, Capitaine. And I did it as well as I could.
Pshhh. I am a monster, not a hero. But I did what I had to do.
You did. And... honestly, I'm impressed.
I... lied to you. I was going to lay out a very different plan. One that didn't rely on Belle magic.
... What?
You heard me. I didn't know what your limits would be.
That's a lot of trust, Capitaine.
It is. But the two of you went beyond my wildest expectations.
Capitaine... I...
I'm proud of you, LT.
Thank you. I... I think I need a moment.
Of course.
... Did you mean what you said back there?
About what?
That I don't respect what you say you need.
... I half meant it. I was angry at Mischief and took it out on you.
Mm. I could say the same.
Why does it matter so much to you? The tattoo?
... I don't want to be abandoned.

Fields.MenuText: What does *that* have to do with the price of milk?
I don't understand. Enlighten me.
... Ah, I think I see. It's a bond that can't be broken.

Fields.DialogueText: You know me too well.
All right. It's like this, Capitaine...
Nothing. But it has a good deal to do with *us.*
... Life is capricious. The Fleet, even more so. If I am assigned a new Capitaine, or if I sink, or if we fall out of love...
Well. Many things can happen.
If I tattoo you, some part of me will always be with you. And some part of you will always be with me.
... If you'd put it *that* way, we could have solved this immediately.
You come on real strong. Maybe too strong.

Fields.MenuText: ... But, you know... this is important to you. And now that I understand it...

Fields.DialogueText: ... Sure. I'll get the tattoo.
You mean it, Capitaine?
*ALARM*
I'm trying to stop saying things I don't mean. Come on, let's get back to work.
It's not work if you enjoy it.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: And you have to understand how easy that is for a Belle to do. So... I'm sorry.

Fields.DialogueText: *We're* permanent. But so is a tattoo. And that's my decision to make, and I've made it.
... Not quite like a refit, is it?
If it helps, I'll hold your hand for the next one.
Ah! Capitaine, I could--
On one condition. I want to watch you work on someone else first.
Can I look yet?
Not yet, Capitaine. We're almost done with the art-- Provence, what are you DOING?
It's called Cubism. Look it up.
It looks like you broke a plate and shuffled what was left into a snake shape. Try again.
I am trying to show the snake from every angle at once.

Fields.MenuText: Who said I even wanted a snake?
I like the way that looks, honestly.
Le Terrible's right. Let's go for a *bit* more realism.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah!
Spoilsport.
I told you. It's cutting-edge.
So sharp you're going to cut yourself.
You said you wanted one that would match mine, did you not?
Oh, right. It looks good. Though... I think there's something off with the eyes...
... All right. It needs a few tweaks, but... I think this is art we can be proud of. Capitaine?
*A FEW ARGUMENTS LATER*

Fields.MenuText: I like it. It feels... right.

Fields.DialogueText: All right. Let's test this on Provence before she has to leave.
*ALARM*
Himmeldonnerwetter!
Ugh. Instead of one more art project together, we get one more fight.
Let's make it count.
@BATTLE
My body is your canvas!

Fields.MenuText: It's good. But... how would you feel about preserving all these designs?

Fields.DialogueText: Je ne comprends pas. Most of them are self-indulgent twaddle.
Bof.
No, they're not. When the war's over, this is the stuff I'm going to actually *want* to remember. I feel like we should have somebody trying to preserve it.
That's why I'm putting the best of the designs on Provence's thigh.
Well, I'm sorry we have to say goodbye to Provence, but...
The ship'll be quieter without her aboard. You painted flowers all over my deck.
I'll give you pointy. Take your shirt off. Before we're back on the clock.
You don't see the irony here?
What irony?
Never mind. Need a hand, Provence?
Hold still, flower girl.
Nnnn.
How's she holding up, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: She hasn't squeezed once.
Provence, ease up!
Just fine.

Fields.DialogueText: You're a masochist? Capitaine, if you're ever interested, I'd love to make *both* of you scream.
... Oh my *god.*
Ah, the manic is a stoic. Well. This shouldn't take *too* much longer--
At least you're honest. Well, don't worry, this won't take too much longer-
*ALARM*
... Should have seen that coming.
Let's bandage this quickly and get back to the fight.
... Heh. That's just like you.
Mm?
You're the monster who makes the wound and the healer who bandages it. Sharp and tender.
And you wouldn't have me any other way.
Nor I. Patch me up and we'll get back out there!
Already on it.
Tch. All the humanity in the world and you pick the pointiest bits.
Scream if I break it.
I kind of like the way it feels.
It's a good kind of hurt!
@BATTLE
Are they withdrawing?
It's a feint. Make it hurt and they'll commit to the bit... for a time.
